portnotes.Type & Description: Portfolio notes, longer description than allowed in portfolio name

accgroup.Type & Description: Account group, could use to group multiple accounts (e.g. for binders)

accstatus.Type & Description: Account status. Aside from predefined values, you can use other single character values for user specific purposes

flexiacczzz.Type & Description: Flexible field that is stored in FlexiAcc table in ModifierName = ZZZ

polstatus.Type & Description: Policy layer status. Aside from predefined values, other single character values for user specific purposes can be used.

polinceptiondate.Type & Description: Policy inception date - in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD

polexpirydate.Type & Description: Policy expiry date - in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD

lob.Type & Description: Line of business (defined at policy level)

layerparticipation.Type & Description: Insurance company share of the policy layer. Values between 0 to 1 (e.g. 12% entered as 0.12)

layerlimit.Type & Description: Policy layer limit (always treated as amount)

layerattachment.Type & Description: Policy layer attachment point (always treated as amount)

hoursclause.Type & Description: For perils with an inherent event duration, the insurance contract may contain an hours clause that limits the time in which claims can be added up and assigned to one event

pollimitcode6all.Type & Description: Policy blanket limit code (annual aggregate only)

steptriggertype.Type & Description: Code that represents how, and for which coverages, pay-outs are triggered.

stepnumber.Type & Description: Number between 1 and 10 that is used to sort the step function in the correct order.

payouttype.Type & Description: Refers to PayoutBuilding, PayoutContents, PayoutBuildingContents. Payout can be % TIV, % Loss, a monetary amount, or % Limit.

triggertype.Type & Description: Refers to TriggerStart and TriggerEnd fields which could be specified as a % TIV, % Loss or a monetary amount.

triggerbuildingstart.Type & Description: Starting value of the building damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.

triggerbuildingend.Type & Description: Ending value of the building damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.

deductiblebuilding.Type & Description: Building deductible that can be used, for example, to account for fire policies before applying step functions.

payoutbuildingstart.Type & Description: Pay-out amount for the building losses for this step. If a ramp policy then it represents the start payout value.

payoutbuildingend.Type & Description: Pay-out amount for the end-point building losses for this ramp. This field should only be used if you have a ramp policy to indicate the end of the building payout. Otherwise, it should be left blank.

triggercontentsstart.Type & Description: Starting value of the content damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.

triggercontentsend.Type & Description: Ending value of the content damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.

deductiblecontents.Type & Description: Content deductible that can be used, for example, to account for fire policies before applying step functions.

payoutcontentsstart.Type & Description: Pay-out amount for the contents losses for this step. If a ramp policy then it represents the start payout value.

payoutcontentsend.Type & Description: Pay-out amount for the end-point contents losses for this ramp. This field should only be used if you have a ramp policy to indicate the end of the contents payout. Otherwise, it should be left blank.

triggerbuildingcontentsstart.Type & Description: Starting value of the building and content damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.

triggerbuildingcontentsend.Type & Description: Ending value of the building and content damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.

deductiblebuildingcontents.Type & Description: Building and contents deductible that can be used, for example, to account for fire policies before applying step functions.

payoutbuildingcontentsstart.Type & Description: Pay-out amount for the building and contents losses for this step. If a ramp policy then it represents the start payout value.

payoutbuildingcontentsend.Type & Description: Pay-out amount for the end-point building and contents losses for this ramp. This field should only be used if you have a ramp policy to indicate the end of the building and contents payout. Otherwise, it should be left blank.

payoutlimitbuildingcontents.Type & Description: Pay-out limit for building and contents

extraexpensefactor.Type & Description: A factor that is applied to main coverage loss for extra expenses. This value, entered as a decimal, should be the same for all steps for a policy contract and must be a value >0 and ≤1. For example, 0.12 for 12%.

extraexpenselimit.Type & Description: A limit that applies to the total extra expense loss

debrisremovalfactor.Type & Description: A factor for a conditional coverage which tends to apply to all steps and is to cover Debris Removal. This value, entered as a decimal, should be the same for all steps for a policy contract and must be a value >0 and ≤1. For example, 0.12 for 12%.

minimumtiv.Type & Description: Minimum replacement value for which pay-outs to the corresponding damage range will be allowed.

scalefactor.Type & Description: Percentage factor used to scale calculated losses. This value, entered as a decimal, should be the same for all steps for a policy contract and must be a value >0 and ≤1. For example, 0.12 for 12%.

islimitatdamage.Type & Description: Indicates whether the pay-out is limited by the actual ground-up loss.

flexipolzzz.Type & Description: Flexible field that is stored in FlexiPol table in ModifierName = ZZZ

condnumber.Type & Description: Condition number identifies a unique set of condition financial terms applicable to one or more CondTag's.

condpriority.Type & Description: Condition priority: specifies the order in which special conditions apply if multiple conditions apply to one location.

conddedcode2other.Type & Description: Special condition other building deductible code

conddedtype2other.Type & Description: Special condition other building deductible type

condminded2other.Type & Description: Special condition minimum other building deductible

condmaxded2other.Type & Description: Special condition maximum other building deductible

condlimitcode2other.Type & Description: Special condition other building limit code

condlimittype2other.Type & Description: Special condition other building limit type

condclass.Type & Description: Flags whether a condition is a policy restriction

condtag.Type & Description: Identifies a group of locations which are subject to one or more conditions.

oedversion.Type & Description: The OED schema version of the file - 'major, minor, patch' format i.e. (2.0.0)

originalcurrency.Type & Description: Original currency in which the business has been written before any conversions

rateofexchange.Type & Description: Rate of exchange used to convert the terms from OriginalCurrency

accparticipation.Type & Description: Insurance company share of the account loss. Values between 0 to 1 (e.g. 12% entered as 0.12)

correlationgroup.Type & Description: Correlation Group: indicates which locations should be correlated between each other in Oasis LMF.

isprimary.Type & Description: Whether the location in LocGroup is the primary building in the group

istenant.Type & Description: Whether property is occupied by a tenant or not

locinceptiondate.Type & Description: Location inception date - in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD

locexpirydate.Type & Description: Location expiry date - in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD

percentcomplete.Type & Description: Completeness percentage of the construction project at this location. The project completion percentage is by the cost of the project. Values between 0 to 1 (e.g. 12% enterd as 0.12)

completiondate.Type & Description: Construction project completion date - in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD

countrycode.Type & Description: Country code (based on ISO3166 alpha-2 codes)

postalcode.Type & Description: Postcode: the highest resolution postcode most often used. (e.g. 5 digit zip for the US).

areacode.Type & Description: Code representing typically the largest sub-division in a country (e.g. State code). See AreaCode Values sheet for details.

areaname.Type & Description: Name relating to the AreaCode (e.g. State name). See AreaCode Values sheet for details.

geogschemexx.Type & Description: Geography scheme: Descriptor of the geography scheme used in relation to the geography name in the corresponding GeogName field (e.g. PC4). The 'XX' must be changed to an integer (GeogScheme1......> GeogScheme30 (max) etc) and the user can specify values in addition to those listed in the GeogScheme values list, but user defined scheme values must start with 'X'.

geognamexx.Type & Description: Geography name: Descriptor of the geographical area, using the scheme referenced in the corresponding GeogScheme field (e.g. SO31)

addressmatch.Type & Description: Address match from geocoder: indicating the resolution that the latitude / longitude represents

geocodequality.Type & Description: Geocode quality (values between 0 and 1 e.g. 80% is entered as 0.8)

geocoder.Type & Description: Company name / version of geocoder. Free text field.

floorarea.Type & Description: Floor area: the total area across all floors

floorareaunit.Type & Description: Units in which FloorArea is specified

flexiloczzz.Type & Description: Flexible field that is stored in FlexiLoc table in ModifierName = ZZZ

othertiv.Type & Description: Other Building Insured Value (primarily aimed at specific US policies). For motor exposures, use this field for TIV along with appropriate motor construction code.

bipoi.Type & Description: BI period of indemnity (in days, in increments of 0.5 days). Default value = 365 (1 year).

locgrosspremium.Type & Description: Gross premium amount at location level

loctax.Type & Description: Insurance tax amount at location level

noncatgrounduploss.Type & Description: Ground-Up non-cat loss value prior to the application of non-cat policy terms

locparticipation.Type & Description: Percentage of risk that the insurer covers for this location. Values between 0 to 1 (e.g. 12% enterd as 0.12). Usually used in binders or offshore.

payoutbasis.Type & Description: Pay-out basis for the claim (whether depreciation is taken into account). ACV = RCV - depreciation.

reinstag.Type & Description: User defined reinsurance tag to provide a further option for specifying reinsurance scope

yearupgraded.Type & Description: Year the building was upgraded (4 digit year)

surgeleakage.Type & Description: Storm leakage percentage (0% to 100%) for Wind only policies

percentsprinklered.Type & Description: Percent sprinklered. Values between 0 and 1 inclusive (0.5 = 50%); -999 is unknown

roofcover.Type & Description: Code that represents the material used to cover the roof

roofyearbuilt.Type & Description: Year the roof was last replaced (4 digit year)

roofgeometry.Type & Description: Code that represents the shape of the roof

roofequipment.Type & Description: captures if mechanical or electric equipment is braced on the roof and the impact this modifier will have on the losses.

roofmaintenance.Type & Description: Captures the impact roof maintenance has on the losses

roofattachedstructures.Type & Description: Code that identifies items mounted on the roof, such as A/C units, skylights, or dormers

roofdeck.Type & Description: Code that represents the materials used to construct the roof deck

roofpitch.Type & Description: Code that represents the slope of the roof

roofanchorage.Type & Description: Code that represents the connections used to secure the roof support system to the walls

roofdeckattachment.Type & Description: Code that represents the connections used to secure the roof deck to the underlying roof support system

roofcoverattachment.Type & Description: Code that represents the connections used to secure the roof covering to the roof deck

glasstype.Type & Description: Code that represents the type of glass used in the building

latticetype.Type & Description: Code that represents the type of web used for H-shaped steel

softstory.Type & Description: Code that indicates if there is structural weakness at any floor.  First floor garages and taller first floors are likely to exhibit soft-story behaviour.

basement.Type & Description: Code that defines if there is a basement and if so whether it is finished or unfinished

basementlevelcount.Type & Description: Indicates the number of basement levels in a structure (supports up to 5 levels; for more than 5, enter 5).

windowprotection.Type & Description: Code that represents the wind protection systems used on the windows

foundationtype.Type & Description: Code that represents the construction type of the building's foundation

wallattachedstructure.Type & Description: Code that represents a structure that is physically attached to the building, such as garage or balcony

appurtenantstructure.Type & Description: Code for the appurtenant building, such as shed or detached garage

groundequipment.Type & Description: Captures whether mechanical or electrical equipment are present on the ground level of a building and impact it has on losses

equipmentbracing.Type & Description: Identifies where mechanical or electrical equipment is held in place by bracing

flashing.Type & Description: Refers to the impact the quality of the flashing or coping on a roof has on losses

buildingshape.Type & Description: Code that represents the shape of the building

shapeirregularity.Type & Description: Identifies vertical irregularities, overhangs and setbacks in the building design

pounding.Type & Description: Code that represents the distance to the closest structure, which if not adequate, can cause the two structures to collide during earthquake shaking

ornamentation.Type & Description: Code that represents the amount of decorative elements attached to the exterior of a building

specialeqconstruction.Type & Description: Presence of a seismic base isolation system

retrofit.Type & Description: Presence of retro fit connectivity between walls and floor for retro fit buildings

cripplewall.Type & Description: Presence of cripple walls on the first floor or frame buildings

foundationconnection.Type & Description: Connection of frame to foundation with or without bolts

shortcolumn.Type & Description: Code that indicates if there are short columns in the building

fatigue.Type & Description: Captures signs of damage from prior earthquakes

cladding.Type & Description: The presence and material of exterior building cladding

firstfloorheight.Type & Description: Height of the lowest floor (above ground) of the building with respect to local ground elevation (NOT relative to datum). First floor in the US is identical to ground floor in Europe.

firstfloorheightunit.Type & Description: Code for the unit of measure used to express FirstFloorHeight

datum.Type & Description: Datum reference for the elevation fields (e.g. NAVD88; WGS84)

groundelevation.Type & Description: Flood or Windstorm - Elevation of the local ground surface at the building at this location. This field represents the elevation of the grade (local ground surface) with respect to the datum (e.g. NAVD88).

groundelevationunit.Type & Description: Code for the unit of measure used to express the GroundElevation

tank.Type & Description: Code that indicates if there are rooftop tanks on the adjoining higher buildings

redundancy.Type & Description: Indicates whether there are multiple lateral load resisting elements, such as frames or shear walls

internalpartition.Type & Description: Interior wall partitions or chimneys made from URM

externaldoors.Type & Description: Wind resistant doors, doors with a certain rating of hurricane protection

torsion.Type & Description: Code that represents the layout of structural elements that can lead to torsional loads

mechanicalequipmentside.Type & Description: Mechanical or electrical equipment at the side

contentswindvuln.Type & Description: Contents relative vulnerability to windstorm or tornado

smalldebris.Type & Description: Code that identifies whether small debris are present within 200 meters of the structure

floorsoccupied.Type & Description: Number of floors in the building that are occupied (separated by semi-colons). Each floor occupied is separated by a semi-colon. Ranges are not accepted. 0 = ground floor, -1 = first level of basement, -2 = second level of basement; 1 = first floor, 2 = second floor, etc.

flooddefenseheight.Type & Description: Height of any site specific flood defenses protecting the property with respect to local ground elevation (NOT to datum).

flooddefenseheightunit.Type & Description: Code for the unit of measure used to express the FloodDefenseHeight

flooddebrisresilience.Type & Description: Shows if building is vulnerable to floating debris

basefloodelevation.Type & Description: Water surface elevation (relative to datum - this is NOT a flood depth) corresponding to a flood having a 1% probability of being equaled or exceeded in a given year. A value of -999 for this field represents unknown/default.

basefloodelevationunit.Type & Description: Code for the unit of measure used to express the BaseFloodElevation

buildingvaluation.Type & Description: Field for third party valuation data

treeexposure.Type & Description: Secondary modifier coding density of trees adjacent to structure

chimney.Type & Description: Code that indicates if the structure has a chimney and, if so, the height of the chimney

packaging.Type & Description: Describes the susceptibility of the packaging of a risk to the peril

protection.Type & Description: Describes the level of protection from the specific peril

salvageprotection.Type & Description: The salvage potential of a particular product

valuablesstorage.Type & Description: Where the specie element is stored

daysheld.Type & Description: Number of days cargo is kept at port or the duration of an exhibition. Values between 0 to 1825 (up to 5 years). Default = 365.

brickveneer.Type & Description: Code that represents the percentage of external walls that consist of brick veneer.

femacompliance.Type & Description: Indicates whether the building is in compliance with the FEMA flood zone requirements in both design and construction

customfloodsop.Type & Description: Standard of flood protection return period; values from 0-10,000

multistoryhall.Type & Description: Code that indicates if the building has a multi-story hall

buildingexterioropening.Type & Description: Code that represents the percentage of exterior walls that are open (i.e. have windows or doors)

serviceequipmentprotection.Type & Description: Code that indicates whether the service equipment is protected from flood

tallonestory.Type & Description: The height of the taller than usual one-story building (e.g. gymnasium, auditorium, church, etc.)

staticmotorvehicle.Type & Description: Identifies whether a risk is static or dynamic (moves from location to location)

condtag.Type & Description: Identifies a group of locations which are subject to one or more conditions.

oedversion.Type & Description: The OED schema version of the file - 'major, minor, patch' format i.e. (2.0.0)

isaggregate.Type & Description: Agggrated Data based on NumberOfBuildings field

soiltype.Type & Description: 0 = no soil information, 1 = time averaged shear-wave velocity to 30m depth (vs30 (m/s))

soilvalue.Type & Description: The value associated with the SoilType

numberofoccupants.Type & Description: Total number of occupants at a location (e.g., residents, employees, visitors)

occupantunderfive.Type & Description: Number of occupants aged under 5 years

occupantover65.Type & Description: Number of occupants aged over 65 years

occupanturban.Type & Description: Number of occupants classed as living in an urban area

occupantrural.Type & Description: Number of occupants classed as living in a rural area

occupantpoverty.Type & Description: Number of occupants classed as living in poverty

occupantrefugee.Type & Description: Number of occupants with refugee status

occupantunemployed.Type & Description: Number of occupants classed as unemployed

occupantdisability.Type & Description: Number of occupants with a disability

originalcurrency.Type & Description: Original currency in which the business has been written before any conversions

rateofexchange.Type & Description: Rate of exchange used to convert the terms from OriginalCurrency

offshorewaterdepth.Type & Description: Depth of water for offshore structures (in metres)

sectionlength.Type & Description: Length of line element associated with point location. Intended for line-assets, such as roads, railways and cables. Such an asset can be defined as a series of points along its length, and the 'Length' field describes the length associated with each point. E.g. if a road is coded as points at 2km intervals, then the 'Length' value is 2, and the TIV represents the value for that 2km stretch of road.

powercapacity.Type & Description:
The electrical capacity (e.g. in MW) associated with an infrastructure asset. Intended for power generation and power transmission assets. E.g. power stations, turbines, cables, etc.
Provide the generating capacity of each asset (e.g. for a turbine, this is the capacity of the turbine, not the windfarm).

vulnerabilitysetid.Type & Description: ID allowing custom location level vulnerability to be captured

codeprovision.Type & Description: Code provision for energy, water and communication infrastructure

anchorage.Type & Description: Anchorage of for energy, water and communication infrastructure

voltageofenergy.Type & Description: Voltage of energy infrastructure (applicable to substations, generation facilities and transmission)

pumpingcapacity.Type & Description: Capacity of water pumping and treatment plants, in MGD (Millions gallons per day)

reinslayernumber.Type & Description: Reinsurance layer for information / ordering purposes

reinsinceptiondate.Type & Description: Reinsurance inception date - in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD

reinsexpirydate.Type & Description: Reinsurance expiry date - in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD

cededpercent.Type & Description: Reinsurance ceded percentage. Used mainly in surplus treaties. Applies before other reinsurance terms. Values between 0 to 1 (e.g. 12% entered as 0.12)

occreversefranchise.Type & Description: Reinsurance reverse franchise - a value of loss that, if exceeded, results in no payment being made for this event from the reinsurer to insurer.

agglimit.Type & Description: Maximum amount payable under this treaty during the AggPeriod

aggattachment.Type & Description: The aggregate monetary amount during a given AggPeriod that the resinured retains under this treaty

aggperiod.Type & Description: Aggregate period associated with the aggregate limits and attachments (in days). Default value = 365 (1 year)

placedpercent.Type & Description: Percentage of the limit that has been placed in the reinsurance market. The main percentage used for reinsurance treaties other than surplus. Applies after other reinsurance terms. Values between 0 to 1 (e.g. 12% entered as 0.12)

inuringpriority.Type & Description: Reinsurance inuring priority capturing the order in which reinsurance contracts apply. Treaties with lower number inuring priorities apply first.

reinstatementcharge.Type & Description: Reinstatement charge as %; semi-colon separated if different for each reinstatement (e.g. 1-free, 2-50%, 3-100% should be entered as: 0;0.5;1). If all reinstatements are the same, then just one number is sufficient (e.g. 3 reinstatements at 100% should be entered as 1)

deemedpercentplaced.Type & Description: Deemed percent placed, used to represent notional contracts or any part of the contract being notional. For fully notional contracts, enter 1 (i.e. 100%). For partially placed contracts, enter any value between 0 and 1. For real contracts, enter 0.

reinsfxrate.Type & Description: Reinsurance exchange rate (as the contractual reinsurance rate can be different from the actual exchange rates used for policies and locations)

treatyshare.Type & Description: The percentage of a treaty that a given reinsurer may write. Values between 0 to 1 (e.g. 12% entered as 0.12).

usereinsdates.Type & Description: A flag to indicate if reinsurance contract dates or  policy inception / expiry dates are to be considered when calculating losses (Y) or ignored (N).

risklevel.Type & Description: Code to indicate the definition of 'risk' for the per-risk terms in this particular treaty (or portion of the treaty)

oedversion.Type & Description: The OED schema version of the file - 'major, minor, patch' format i.e. (2.0.0)

originalcurrency.Type & Description: Original currency in which the business has been written before any conversions

rateofexchange.Type & Description: Rate of exchange used to convert the terms from OriginalCurrency

reinsnumber.Type & Description: Reinsurance number to link with ReinsInfo file

portnumber.Type & Description: Portfolio number: used for defining treaty scope in the reinsurance scope file

accnumber.Type & Description: Account number:  used for defining treaty scope in the reinsurance scope file

polnumber.Type & Description: Policy number:  used for defining treaty scope in the reinsurance scope file

locgroup.Type & Description: Location group name:  used for defining treaty scope in the reinsurance scope file

locnumber.Type & Description: Location number:  used for defining treaty scope in the reinsurance scope file

cedantname.Type & Description: Cedant name:  used for defining treaty scope in the reinsurance scope file

producername.Type & Description: Producer name:  used for defining treaty scope in the reinsurance scope file

lob.Type & Description: Line of business:  used for defining treaty scope in the reinsurance scope file

countrycode.Type & Description: Country code: used for defining treaty scope in the reinsurance scope file

reinstag.Type & Description: Reinsurance tag: user defined field to for defining treaty scope in the reinsurance scope file

countrycode.Type & Description: Country code (based on ISO3166 alpha-2 codes)

postalcode.Type & Description: Postcode: the highest resolution postcode most often used. (e.g. 5 digit zip for the US).

areacode.Type & Description: Code representing typically the largest sub-division in a country (e.g. State code). See AreaCode Values sheet for details.

areaname.Type & Description: Name relating to the AreaCode (e.g. State name). See AreaCode Values sheet for details.

geogschemexx.Type & Description: Geography scheme: Descriptor of the geography scheme used in relation to the geography name in the corresponding GeogName field (e.g. PC4). The 'XX' must be changed to an integer (GeogScheme1......> GeogScheme30 (max) etc) and the user can specify values in addition to those listed in the GeogScheme values list, but user defined scheme values must start with 'X'.

geognamexx.Type & Description: Geography name: Descriptor of the geographical area, using the scheme referenced in the corresponding GeogScheme field (e.g. SO31)

addressmatch.Type & Description: Address match from geocoder: indicating the resolution that the latitude / longitude represents

geocodequality.Type & Description: Geocode quality (values between 0 and 1 e.g. 80% is entered as 0.8)

geocoder.Type & Description: Company name / version of geocoder. Free text field.

floorarea.Type & Description: Floor area: the total area across all floors

floorareaunit.Type & Description: Units in which FloorArea is specified

flexiloczzz.Type & Description: Flexible field that is stored in FlexiLoc table in ModifierName = ZZZ

othertiv.Type & Description: Other Building Insured Value (primarily aimed at specific US policies). For motor exposures, use this field for TIV along with appropriate motor construction code.

bipoi.Type & Description: BI period of indemnity (in days, in increments of 0.5 days). Default value = 365 (1 year).

locgrosspremium.Type & Description: Gross premium amount at location level

loctax.Type & Description: Insurance tax amount at location level

noncatgrounduploss.Type & Description: Ground-Up non-cat loss value prior to the application of non-cat policy terms

locparticipation.Type & Description: Percentage of risk that the insurer covers for this location. Values between 0 to 1 (e.g. 12% enterd as 0.12). Usually used in binders or offshore.

payoutbasis.Type & Description: Pay-out basis for the claim (whether depreciation is taken into account). ACV = RCV - depreciation.

reinstag.Type & Description: User defined reinsurance tag to provide a further option for specifying reinsurance scope

yearupgraded.Type & Description: Year the building was upgraded (4 digit year)

surgeleakage.Type & Description: Storm leakage percentage (0% to 100%) for Wind only policies

percentsprinklered.Type & Description: Percent sprinklered. Values between 0 and 1 inclusive (0.5 = 50%); -999 is unknown

roofcover.Type & Description: Code that represents the material used to cover the roof

roofyearbuilt.Type & Description: Year the roof was last replaced (4 digit year)

roofgeometry.Type & Description: Code that represents the shape of the roof

roofequipment.Type & Description: captures if mechanical or electric equipment is braced on the roof and the impact this modifier will have on the losses.

roofmaintenance.Type & Description: Captures the impact roof maintenance has on the losses

roofattachedstructures.Type & Description: Code that identifies items mounted on the roof, such as A/C units, skylights, or dormers

roofdeck.Type & Description: Code that represents the materials used to construct the roof deck

roofpitch.Type & Description: Code that represents the slope of the roof

roofanchorage.Type & Description: Code that represents the connections used to secure the roof support system to the walls

roofdeckattachment.Type & Description: Code that represents the connections used to secure the roof deck to the underlying roof support system

roofcoverattachment.Type & Description: Code that represents the connections used to secure the roof covering to the roof deck

glasstype.Type & Description: Code that represents the type of glass used in the building

latticetype.Type & Description: Code that represents the type of web used for H-shaped steel

softstory.Type & Description: Code that indicates if there is structural weakness at any floor.  First floor garages and taller first floors are likely to exhibit soft-story behaviour.

basement.Type & Description: Code that defines if there is a basement and if so whether it is finished or unfinished

basementlevelcount.Type & Description: Indicates the number of basement levels in a structure (supports up to 5 levels; for more than 5, enter 5).

windowprotection.Type & Description: Code that represents the wind protection systems used on the windows

foundationtype.Type & Description: Code that represents the construction type of the building's foundation

wallattachedstructure.Type & Description: Code that represents a structure that is physically attached to the building, such as garage or balcony

appurtenantstructure.Type & Description: Code for the appurtenant building, such as shed or detached garage

groundequipment.Type & Description: Captures whether mechanical or electrical equipment are present on the ground level of a building and impact it has on losses

equipmentbracing.Type & Description: Identifies where mechanical or electrical equipment is held in place by bracing

flashing.Type & Description: Refers to the impact the quality of the flashing or coping on a roof has on losses

buildingshape.Type & Description: Code that represents the shape of the building

shapeirregularity.Type & Description: Identifies vertical irregularities, overhangs and setbacks in the building design

pounding.Type & Description: Code that represents the distance to the closest structure, which if not adequate, can cause the two structures to collide during earthquake shaking

ornamentation.Type & Description: Code that represents the amount of decorative elements attached to the exterior of a building

specialeqconstruction.Type & Description: Presence of a seismic base isolation system

retrofit.Type & Description: Presence of retro fit connectivity between walls and floor for retro fit buildings

cripplewall.Type & Description: Presence of cripple walls on the first floor or frame buildings

foundationconnection.Type & Description: Connection of frame to foundation with or without bolts

shortcolumn.Type & Description: Code that indicates if there are short columns in the building

fatigue.Type & Description: Captures signs of damage from prior earthquakes

cladding.Type & Description: The presence and material of exterior building cladding

firstfloorheight.Type & Description: Height of the lowest floor (above ground) of the building with respect to local ground elevation (NOT relative to datum). First floor in the US is identical to ground floor in Europe.

firstfloorheightunit.Type & Description: Code for the unit of measure used to express FirstFloorHeight

datum.Type & Description: Datum reference for the elevation fields (e.g. NAVD88; WGS84)

groundelevation.Type & Description: Flood or Windstorm - Elevation of the local ground surface at the building at this location. This field represents the elevation of the grade (local ground surface) with respect to the datum (e.g. NAVD88).

groundelevationunit.Type & Description: Code for the unit of measure used to express the GroundElevation

tank.Type & Description: Code that indicates if there are rooftop tanks on the adjoining higher buildings

redundancy.Type & Description: Indicates whether there are multiple lateral load resisting elements, such as frames or shear walls

internalpartition.Type & Description: Interior wall partitions or chimneys made from URM

externaldoors.Type & Description: Wind resistant doors, doors with a certain rating of hurricane protection

torsion.Type & Description: Code that represents the layout of structural elements that can lead to torsional loads

mechanicalequipmentside.Type & Description: Mechanical or electrical equipment at the side

contentswindvuln.Type & Description: Contents relative vulnerability to windstorm or tornado

smalldebris.Type & Description: Code that identifies whether small debris are present within 200 meters of the structure

floorsoccupied.Type & Description: Number of floors in the building that are occupied (separated by semi-colons). Each floor occupied is separated by a semi-colon. Ranges are not accepted. 0 = ground floor, -1 = first level of basement, -2 = second level of basement; 1 = first floor, 2 = second floor, etc.

flooddefenseheight.Type & Description: Height of any site specific flood defenses protecting the property with respect to local ground elevation (NOT to datum).

flooddefenseheightunit.Type & Description: Code for the unit of measure used to express the FloodDefenseHeight

flooddebrisresilience.Type & Description: Shows if building is vulnerable to floating debris

basefloodelevation.Type & Description: Water surface elevation (relative to datum - this is NOT a flood depth) corresponding to a flood having a 1% probability of being equaled or exceeded in a given year. A value of -999 for this field represents unknown/default.

basefloodelevationunit.Type & Description: Code for the unit of measure used to express the BaseFloodElevation

buildingvaluation.Type & Description: Field for third party valuation data

treeexposure.Type & Description: Secondary modifier coding density of trees adjacent to structure

chimney.Type & Description: Code that indicates if the structure has a chimney and, if so, the height of the chimney

packaging.Type & Description: Describes the susceptibility of the packaging of a risk to the peril

protection.Type & Description: Describes the level of protection from the specific peril

salvageprotection.Type & Description: The salvage potential of a particular product

valuablesstorage.Type & Description: Where the specie element is stored

daysheld.Type & Description: Number of days cargo is kept at port or the duration of an exhibition. Values between 0 to 1825 (up to 5 years). Default = 365.

brickveneer.Type & Description: Code that represents the percentage of external walls that consist of brick veneer.

femacompliance.Type & Description: Indicates whether the building is in compliance with the FEMA flood zone requirements in both design and construction

customfloodsop.Type & Description: Standard of flood protection return period; values from 0-10,000

multistoryhall.Type & Description: Code that indicates if the building has a multi-story hall

buildingexterioropening.Type & Description: Code that represents the percentage of exterior walls that are open (i.e. have windows or doors)

serviceequipmentprotection.Type & Description: Code that indicates whether the service equipment is protected from flood

tallonestory.Type & Description: The height of the taller than usual one-story building (e.g. gymnasium, auditorium, church, etc.)

reinslayernumber.Type & Description: Reinsurance layer for information / ordering purposes

reinsinceptiondate.Type & Description: Reinsurance inception date - in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD

reinsexpirydate.Type & Description: Reinsurance expiry date - in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD

cededpercent.Type & Description: Reinsurance ceded percentage. Used mainly in surplus treaties. Applies before other reinsurance terms. Values between 0 to 1 (e.g. 12% entered as 0.12)

occreversefranchise.Type & Description: Reinsurance reverse franchise - a value of loss that, if exceeded, results in no payment being made for this event from the reinsurer to insurer.

agglimit.Type & Description: Maximum amount payable under this treaty during the AggPeriod

aggattachment.Type & Description: The aggregate monetary amount during a given AggPeriod that the resinured retains under this treaty

aggperiod.Type & Description: Aggregate period associated with the aggregate limits and attachments (in days). Default value = 365 (1 year)

placedpercent.Type & Description: Percentage of the limit that has been placed in the reinsurance market. The main percentage used for reinsurance treaties other than surplus. Applies after other reinsurance terms. Values between 0 to 1 (e.g. 12% entered as 0.12)

inuringpriority.Type & Description: Reinsurance inuring priority capturing the order in which reinsurance contracts apply. Treaties with lower number inuring priorities apply first.

reinstatementcharge.Type & Description: Reinstatement charge as %; semi-colon separated if different for each reinstatement (e.g. 1-free, 2-50%, 3-100% should be entered as: 0;0.5;1). If all reinstatements are the same, then just one number is sufficient (e.g. 3 reinstatements at 100% should be entered as 1)

deemedpercentplaced.Type & Description: Deemed percent placed, used to represent notional contracts or any part of the contract being notional. For fully notional contracts, enter 1 (i.e. 100%). For partially placed contracts, enter any value between 0 and 1. For real contracts, enter 0.

reinsfxrate.Type & Description: Reinsurance exchange rate (as the contractual reinsurance rate can be different from the actual exchange rates used for policies and locations)

treatyshare.Type & Description: The percentage of a treaty that a given reinsurer may write. Values between 0 to 1 (e.g. 12% entered as 0.12).

usereinsdates.Type & Description: A flag to indicate if reinsurance contract dates or  policy inception / expiry dates are to be considered when calculating losses (Y) or ignored (N).

risklevel.Type & Description: Code to indicate the definition of 'risk' for the per-risk terms in this particular treaty (or portion of the treaty)

staticmotorvehicle.Type & Description: Identifies whether a risk is static or dynamic (moves from location to location)

condclass.Type & Description: Flags whether a condition is a policy restriction

condtag.Type & Description: Identifies a group of locations which are subject to one or more conditions.

oedversion.Type & Description: The OED schema version of the file - 'major, minor, patch' format i.e. (2.0.0)

isaggregate.Type & Description: Agggrated Data based on NumberOfBuildings field

soiltype.Type & Description: 0 = no soil information, 1 = time averaged shear-wave velocity to 30m depth (vs30 (m/s))

soilvalue.Type & Description: The value associated with the SoilType

numberofoccupants.Type & Description: Total number of occupants at a location (e.g., residents, employees, visitors)

occupantunderfive.Type & Description: Number of occupants aged under 5 years

occupantover65.Type & Description: Number of occupants aged over 65 years

occupanturban.Type & Description: Number of occupants classed as living in an urban area

occupantrural.Type & Description: Number of occupants classed as living in a rural area

occupantpoverty.Type & Description: Number of occupants classed as living in poverty

occupantrefugee.Type & Description: Number of occupants with refugee status

occupantunemployed.Type & Description: Number of occupants classed as unemployed

occupantdisability.Type & Description: Number of occupants with a disability

originalcurrency.Type & Description: Original currency in which the business has been written before any conversions

rateofexchange.Type & Description: Rate of exchange used to convert the terms from OriginalCurrency

offshorewaterdepth.Type & Description: Depth of water for offshore structures (in metres)

sectionlength.Type & Description: Length of line element associated with point location. Intended for line-assets, such as roads, railways and cables. Such an asset can be defined as a series of points along its length, and the 'Length' field describes the length associated with each point. E.g. if a road is coded as points at 2km intervals, then the 'Length' value is 2, and the TIV represents the value for that 2km stretch of road.

powercapacity.Type & Description:
The electrical capacity (e.g. in MW) associated with an infrastructure asset. Intended for power generation and power transmission assets. E.g. power stations, turbines, cables, etc.
Provide the generating capacity of each asset (e.g. for a turbine, this is the capacity of the turbine, not the windfarm).

vulnerabilitysetid.Type & Description: ID allowing custom location level vulnerability to be captured

codeprovision.Type & Description: Code provision for energy, water and communication infrastructure

anchorage.Type & Description: Anchorage of for energy, water and communication infrastructure

voltageofenergy.Type & Description: Voltage of energy infrastructure (applicable to substations, generation facilities and transmission)

pumpingcapacity.Type & Description: Capacity of water pumping and treatment plants, in MGD (Millions gallons per day)

accparticipation.Type & Description: Insurance company share of the account loss. Values between 0 to 1 (e.g. 12% entered as 0.12)

CSB.Peril Description: Cyber Security Data and Privacy Breach

1050.Name: Residential, General residential
1050.Description: General Residential is a composite of all other Residential Occupancies. You can select this occupancy class code if you have no specific information about the risk.

1051.Name: Residential, Permanent dwelling: single-family
1051.Description: Single-unit detached dwellings usually occupied by a single family.

1052.Name: Residential, Permanent dwelling: multi-family
1052.Description: Multiple-unit dwellings usually occupied by more than one family.

1053.Name: Residential, Temporary lodging
1053.Description: Commercial establishments known to the public as hotels, motels, motor hotels, or tourist courts primarily engaged in providing lodging or lodging and meals to the general public. This category includes hotels that are operated by organizations for members only. Also, establishments primarily engaged in renting, such as boarding houses, lodging houses, or rooming houses.

1054.Name: Residential, Group institutional housing
1054.Description: Residential units under institutional control. Examples include college dormitories, nursing homes, and retirement centers where medical care is incidental.

1055.Name: Residential, Apartment/Condo
1055.Description: Attached, multi-unit housing usually occupied by one family per unit.

1056.Name: Residential, Mid-Terraced Housing
1056.Description: Attached residential unit, not end of terrace (use separate occ code 1072). Also referred to as townhouses, row houses, row homes, or brownstones. Usually more than one story and built close to the street.

1057.Name: Residential, Renter
1057.Description: Site-built home, apartment, or condominium unit (excludes manufactured and mobile homes), on rent. (Usually coverage includes personal property, additional living expenses and liability, but does not include coverage for the structure itself).

1058.Name: Residential Apartment/Condo Asso, Common Areas
1058.Description: Common areas of the Apartment/ Condominium that is shared with all the other residents, like the roof, elevator, basement, courtyards or walkways, pools, common gym or event space, parks etc.

1071.Name: Residential, semi-detached house
1071.Description: Attached residential unit. Shares a single common party wall, commonly found in the UK/Ireland

1072.Name: Residential, end-terrace house
1072.Description: Attached residential unit. Used for end of row terracedhouses with additional end gable exposure to wind

1073.Name: Residential, bungalow
1073.Description: Detached residential unit. One story, often with dormer roof. For semi-detached and terraced bungalows, use those codes with single storey coding.

1100.Name: Commercial, General commercial
1100.Description: General Commercial is a composite of all other Commercial Occupancies. You can select this occupancy class code if you have no specific information about the risk.

1101.Name: Commercial, Retail trade
1101.Description: Retail stores including those establishments that sell building materials and hardware, general merchandise, food, apparel and accessories, home furniture, furnishings and appliances, and prepared food and drinks. Includes automotive dealers, gasoline service stations, and motorcycle, boat, and recreational vehicle dealers. Includes other retail such as drug stores, liquor stores, bookstores, used merchandise, jewelry stores, and piece goods stores. Also includes non-store retailers and fuel dealers.

1102.Name: Commercial, Wholesale trade
1102.Description: Includes wholesale distribution of durable goods including motor vehicles and parts, home furnishings, lumber and construction materials, professional and commercial equipment, metals and minerals, electrical goods, hardware, plumbing and heating equipment, machinery, equipment and supplies, and other miscellaneous durable goods. Also includes wholesale distribution of non-durable goods including paper and paper products, drugs, apparel, groceries, farm-product raw materials, chemicals, petroleum and petroleum related products, alcoholic beverages, and other miscellaneous non-durable goods.

1103.Name: Commercial, Personal and repair services
1103.Description: Includes personal services such as laundry and dry cleaning services, beauty and barbershops, shoe repair shops, photographic studios, and funeral services, as well as automotive rental and leasing, automotive repair shops, and other automotive service including car washes and miscellaneous repair services.

1104.Name: Commercial, Professional,  technical and business
1104.Description: Occupancies involved in the financial industry including depository institutions, non-depository credit institutions, security and commodity brokers, dealers and exchanges, insurance carriers, insurance agents and brokers, and real estate and other investment offices. Includes business services such as advertising agencies, consumer credit reporting agencies, mailing services, reproduction services, commercial art services, building cleaning and pest control services, equipment rental/leasing operations, employment agencies, computer programming, and computer rental/maintenance services. Also included in this occupancy class are legal services, engineering and architectural services, accounting services, research and development services, and management/public relations services. Executive offices, legislative bodies, and government offices are included in this occupancy class as are government establishments engaged in finance and taxation, in environmental quality and housing programs, and in the administration of economic programs including transportation, communications and utilities, agriculture, space and technology, national security and internal affairs, as well as government establishments engaged in human resource programs such as public health, veterans affairs, education, and social and human resources.

1105.Name: Commercial, Health care services - General
1105.Description: Occupancies include medical, surgical, and other health services including clinics, laboratories and other health services. For hospitals, use 1106.

1108.Name: Commercial, Entertainment and recreation - General
1108.Description: This occupancy class includes motion picture production and distribution facilities including motion picture theaters and video tape rental establishments, dance studios, theatrical production (other than motion picture), bowling centers, sports clubs, and physical fitness facilities, as well as art galleries, arboreta, and botanical and zoological gardens.

1112.Name: Commercial, Temporary exhibition facility or circus

1114.Name: Commercial, Golf Courses
1114.Description: Golf courses and related buildings and facilities.

1119.Name: Commercial, Restaurant, café, bar, pub, club, tavern, discotheque
1119.Description: This occupancy includes restaurants, fast food centers, and cafés.

1120.Name: Commercial, Gasoline Station
1120.Description: Retail establishments selling gasoline for use in motor vehicles, including associated retail stores and service bays.

1121.Name: Commercial, Automotive repair services and carwash
1121.Description: Includes car washes and motor vehicle repair and service businesses that do not also sell gasoline. If the repair service is part of a gasoline station, with gasoline pumps under a canopy, use occupancy Commercial, Gasoline Station - 1120.

1123.Name: Commercial, Communication
1123.Description: Includes establishments furnishing point-to-point communications services, whether intended to be received aurally or visually, as well as radio and television broadcasting.

1150.Name: Industrial, General industrial
1150.Description: General industrial is a composite of all other industrial occupancies. You can select this occupancy class code if you have no specific information about the risk.

1151.Name: Industrial,  Heavy fabrication and assembly
1151.Description: Includes commercial fishing, hunting and trapping, operation of timber tracts, tree farms, forestry, nurseries and related activities, and establishments engaged in the cutting of timber and pulpwood. Includes the manufacture of furniture and other wood products, pulps from wood and other sources, tires and various other rubber and plastic products, glass products, cement, structural clay products, pottery, concrete and gypsum products, cut stone, and abrasive and asbestos products. Includes the manufacture of industrial and commercial machinery and equipment such as engines and turbines, farm and garden machinery, construction and mining equipment, metalworking machinery, special industry machinery, general industrial machinery, computer and office equipment, refrigeration machinery, and miscellaneous industrial machinery. Also includes the manufacture of motor vehicles, aircraft and aircraft parts, ship/boat building and repair, railroad equipment, motorcycles and bicycles, guided missiles, space vehicles, and transport equipment.

1152.Name: Industrial, Light fabrication and assembly
1152.Description: Occupancies involved in the preparation and manufacture of yarn, thread, twine, and cordage, in the manufacture of fabrics, carpets, and rugs, and in the dyeing and finishing of fiber, yarn, and fabrics. Includes the manufacture of apparel, felt goods, lace goods, non-woven fabrics, miscellaneous textiles, and textile products. Includes the manufacture of household, office, and restaurant furniture, as well as office and store fixtures. Includes occupancies involved in the publishing and/or printing trade and in service industries related to the printing trade. This occupancy class also includes tanning, currying, and finishing of hides and skins, manufacturing of finished leather and artificial leather products, jewelry, musical instruments, dolls, and toys, as well as other miscellaneous manufacturing.

1153.Name: Industrial, Food and drug processing
1153.Description: Includes food and beverage manufacturing and processing and the manufacturing of cigarettes, cigars, and chewing and smoking tobacco.

1154.Name: Industrial, Chemical processing
1154.Description: Establishments involved in the manufacture of basic chemicals including acids, alkalis, salts, and organic chemicals, as well as chemical products that are to be used in further manufacturing including synthetic fibers, plastic materials, dry colors, and pigments. Includes the manufacture of finished products used for ultimate consumption including drugs, cosmetics, and soaps, as well as products used as supplies in other industries including paints, fertilizers, and explosives.

1155.Name: Industrial, Metal and minerals processing
1155.Description: Includes the smelting and refining of metals, the manufacture of castings, other basic metal products, nails, spikes, insulated wire, and cable, the production of coke, the fabrication of metal products including metal cans, tin ware, hand tools, cutlery, and general hardware, and metal forging.

1156.Name: Industrial, High technology
1156.Description: Includes occupancies involved in the manufacture of machinery and supplies for the generation, storage, transmission, transformation, and utilization of electrical energy including electricity distribution equipment, industrial apparatus, household appliances, electrical lighting, and wiring equipment. Includes manufacturing instruments for measuring, testing, analyzing, and controlling, optical instruments and lenses, surveying and drafting instruments, hydrological, meteorological, navigational, surgical, medical, ophthalmic, and photographic equipment. Also included are watches and clocks.

1157.Name: Industrial, Construction
1157.Description: This occupancy includes general contractors and builders of residential, farm, industrial, commercial, and other buildings, as well as general contractors involved in heavy construction including highways, streets, bridges, tunnels, etc. Also included are special trade contractors including painting, electrical work, carpentry work, plumbing, heating, roofing, etc.

1158.Name: Industrial, Petroleum
1158.Description: Establishments involved in petroleum refining, in the manufacture of paving and roofing materials, of compounding and lubricating oils and greases. Also includes the transportation of petroleum and other commodities, other than natural gas, through pipelines.

1159.Name: Industrial, Mining
1159.Description: Includes mining and exploring for metallic and nonmetallic minerals, as well as the mining and preparation of coal. Includes the extraction of oil from sand and shale and the production of natural gasoline.

1200.Name: Religion and Nonprofit, Religion and nonprofit
1200.Description: Includes organizations operating on a membership basis for the promotion of the interests of their members. Included are organizations such as trade associations, professional membership organizations, labor unions and similar labor organizations, and political and religious organizations.

1201.Name: Religion and Nonprofit,  Church
1201.Description: Establishments of religious organizations operated for worship, religious training or study, government or administration of an organized religion, or promotion of religious activities.

1210.Name: Government, General services
1210.Description: Includes offices of executives, legislative bodies, and general government offices, not elsewhere classified.

1220.Name: Government, Emergency services
1220.Description: Includes government establishments engaged in justice, public order, and safety.

1230.Name: Education, Universities,  colleges and technical schools
1230.Description: Establishments providing academic or technical instruction. Also included are establishments providing educational services such as libraries, student exchange programs, and curriculum development.

1231.Name: Education, Primary and secondary schools
1231.Description: Includes institutions engaged in instruction at primary and secondary level.

1252.Name: Transportation, Air
1252.Description: Establishments furnishing services incidental to transportation, such as forwarding and packing services, as well as the arrangement of passenger and freight transportation

1253.Name: Transportation, Sea and inland waterways
1253.Description: Businesses engaged in freight and passenger transportation on the open seas or inland waters and establishments furnishing such incidental services as lighterage, towing, and canal operation. Also includes excursion and sightseeing boats and water taxis.

1255.Name: Transportation,  Aircrafts at ramps or boarding gates
1255.Description: Aircraft at ramps or boarding gates.

1256.Name: Transportation, General
1256.Description: Composite of all other Transportation Occupancies. You can select this occupancy class code if you have no specific information about the risk.

1300.Name: Utilities, Electrical
1300.Description: Establishments engaged in the generation, transmission, and/or distribution of electric energy for sale. Includes electric power generation, transmission, or distribution.

1301.Name: Utilities, Water
1301.Description: Establishments primarily engaged in distributing water for sale for domestic, commercial, and industrial use.

1302.Name: Utilities, Sanitary sewer
1302.Description: Establishments primarily engaged in the collection and disposal of wastes conducted through a sewer system, including such treatment processes as may be provided and establishments primarily engaged in the collection and disposal of refuse by processing or destruction or in the operation of incinerators, waste treatment plants, landfills, or other sites for disposal of such materials.

1303.Name: Utilities, Natural gas
1303.Description: Establishments engaged in the transmission and distribution and/or storage of natural gas for sale.

1304.Name: Utilities,  Telephone and telegraph
1304.Description: Establishments primarily engaged in providing paging and beeper services and those engaged in leasing telephone lines or other methods of telephone transmission, such as optical fiber lines and microwave or satellite facilities, as well as reselling the use of such methods to others.

1305.Name: Utilities, General
1305.Description: Composite of all other Utility Occupancies (Utilities- Electrical, Utilities- Water, Utilities- Sanitary Sewer, Utilities- Natural Gas, Utilities- Telephone and Telegraph, Utilities- Radio and TV, Utilities- Flood Control). You can select this occupancy class code if you have no specific information about the risk.

1350.Name: Flood control
1350.Description: Government establishments primarily engaged in regulation, planning, protection, and conservation of air and water resources, solid waste management, water and air pollution control and prevention, flood control, drainage development, consumption of water resources, as well as coordination of these activities at intergovernmental levels and research necessary for air pollution abatement and control and conservation of water resources.

1351.Name: Agriculture
1351.Description: Establishments primarily engaged in performing soil preparation services, crop services, veterinary services, other animal services, farm labor and management services, and landscape and horticultural services for others on a contract or fee basis.

1352.Name: Green House
1352.Description: Includes establishments (e.g., farms, orchards, greenhouses, and nurseries) primarily engaged in the production of crops, plants, vines, and trees (excluding forestry operations). This major group also includes establishments primarily engaged in the operation of sod farms and cranberry bogs, in the production of mushrooms, bulbs, flower seeds, and vegetable seeds, and in the growing of hydroponic crops.

2050.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Heavy Fabrication and Assembly - General
2050.Description: Includes manufacturing and processing of automobiles, fabricated metals, machinery/equipment for industry, transportation equipment, pulp/paper and allied products, textile products, lumber and wood products, and stone/glass/clay/ceramics products.

2051.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Automotive Manufacturing

2052.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Fabricated Metal Products

2053.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Industrial and commercial machinery and equipment

2054.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Transportation Equipment Assembly

2055.Name: Industrial Facilities Model,  IFM: Pulp/Paper and Allied Products Manufacturing

2056.Name: Industrial Facilities Model,  IFM: Textile Mill Product

2057.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Lumber and wood products (excluding furniture)

2058.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Stone/Clay/Glass/Ceramics products

2100.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Light Fabrication and Assembly - General
2100.Description: Includes manufacturing and processing of furniture/fixtures, apparel, printing/publishing/allied products, rubber, miscellaneous products, leather/leather products, electronic/other electronic equipment (except computer equipment), measuring/controlling instruments, photographic/medical/optical goods, watches/clocks, tire manufacturers, and miscellaneous manufacturing industries.

2101.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Furniture and Fixtures

2102.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Apparel and finished products from fabrics

2103.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Print/Publishing and allied industry

2104.Name: Industrial Facilities Model,  IFM: Rubber and miscellaneous plastics products

2105.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Leather and Leather products

2106.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Electronic and other electrical equipment (except computer equipment)

2107.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Measuring analyzing and controlling instruments

2108.Name: Industrial Facilities Model,  IFM: Photographic medical and optical goods

2109.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Watches and clocks

2110.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Miscellaneous Light Manufacturing Industries

2111.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Tire manufacturers

2150.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Food and Drug Processing- General
2150.Description: Includes food and beverage manufacturing and processing and the manufacturing of cigarettes, cigars, chewing tobacco, pharmaceuticals, biological products, wineries, and smoking tobacco.

2151.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Food and kindred products

2152.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Tobacco products

2153.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Pharmaceutical plants

2154.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Biological Products(except diagnostic) - Medicinals/Botanical/Biomedical

2200.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Chemical Processing - General
2200.Description: Establishments involved in the manufacture of basic chemicals including acids, alkalis, salts, and organic chemicals and of chemical products that are to be used in further manufacturing including synthetic fibers, plastic materials, dry colors, and pigments. Includes the manufacture of finished products used for ultimate consumption including drugs, cosmetics, and soaps, as well as products used as supplies in other industries including paints, fertilizers, and explosives.

2201.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Chlorine plants

2202.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Vinyl plants

2203.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Light hydrocarbon or aromatics plants

2204.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Plastics plants

2205.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Chlorhydrin plants

2206.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Fertilizer plants

2207.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Cement plants/Cement Mills

2208.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Other Chemical and Allied Products

2250.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Metal and Minerals Processing- General
2250.Description: Includes the smelting and refining of metals, the manufacture of castings, other basic metal products, nails, spikes, insulated wire, and cable, the production of coke, the fabrication of metal products including metal cans, tin ware, hand tools, cutlery, and general hardware, and metal forging.

2251.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Primary metal industry

2252.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Steel Mills

2300.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: High Technology - General
2300.Description: Includes occupancies involved in the manufacture of machinery and supplies for the generation, storage, transmission, transformation, and utilization of electrical energy including electricity distribution equipment, industrial apparatus, household appliances, electrical lighting, and wiring equipment. Includes manufacturing instruments for measuring, testing, analyzing, and controlling, optical instruments and lenses, surveying and drafting instruments, hydrological, meteorological, navigational, surgical, medical, ophthalmic, and photographic equipment, semi-conductor, computer/electronic devices, and allied products.

2301.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Semi-conductor and related devices

2302.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Electronic computer devices

2303.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Computer storage devices

2304.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Electron tubes

2305.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Printed circuit boards

2350.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: General building/ construction contractors
2350.Description: This occupancy includes general contractors and builders of residential, farm, industrial, commercial, and other buildings, as well as general contractors involved in heavy construction including highways, streets, bridges, tunnels, etc. Also included are special trade contractors including painting, electrical work, carpentry work, plumbing, heating, roofing, etc.

2351.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Heavy Constructions

2352.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Special Trade Contractors

2400.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Mining - General
2400.Description: Includes mining and exploring for metallic and nonmetallic minerals, as well as mining and preparation of coal. Includes the extraction of oil from sand and shale and the production of natural gasoline.

2401.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Mining operations

2402.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Metal mining

2403.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Coal mining

2404.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Mining /Quarrying - Non-metallic mineral (except fuels)

2450.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Oil Refinery Systems - General
2450.Description: An oil refinery is an industrial process plant where crude oil is processed and refined into more useful petroleum products, such as gasoline, diesel fuel, asphalt base, heating oil, kerosene, and liquefied petroleum gas. Oil refineries are typically large sprawling industrial complexes with extensive piping running throughout, carrying streams of fluids between large chemical processing units. Includes establishments involved in petroleum refining, in the manufacture of paving and roofing materials, of compounding and lubricating oils and greases. Also includes the transportation of petroleum and other commodities, other than natural gas, through pipelines.

2460.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Oil Production Systems - General

2461.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Oil Production Systems - Oil field wells

2470.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Oil Transmission Systems - General
2470.Description: Oil transportation/ transmission; contains assets such as trunk pipelines, pumping plants, and tank farms (these can be coded specifically by using existing OED construction codes)

2500.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Hydro-Electric Power Systems- General
2500.Description: Establishments engaged in the generation, transmission, and/or distribution of electric energy for sale. Includes electric power generation, transmission, dams, or distribution.

2505.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Geothermal Power Systems- General

2510.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Thermo-Electric Power Systems- General
2510.Description: Establishments engaged in the generation, transmission, and/or distribution of electric energy for sale. Includes electric power generation, transmission, or distribution.

2515.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Tidal Power Systems- General

2520.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Nuclear Power Systems All- General

2521.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: other Nuclear Facilities
2521.Description: Other nuclear facilities (e.g. uranium mining and enrichment, nuclear fuel fabrication, nuclear waste, nuclear medicine, nuclear weapons, nuclear machine building, nuclear plant engineering and construction, nuclear services and maintenance, nuclear R&D, military nuclear production, etc)

2530.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Electric Substation - General
2530.Description: Substations generally contain one or more transformers and have switching, protection, and control equipment. Circuit breakers are used to interrupt any short-circuits or overload currents that may occur on the network. Substations here do not have generators, although a power plant may have a substation nearby. A typical substation will contain line termination structures, high-voltage switch gear, power transformers, switch gear, surge protection, controls, grounding (earthing) system, lightning arrester, and metering. Other devices such as power factor correction capacitors and voltage regulators may also be located at a substation.

2531.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Electric Transmission Lines - General

2541.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Solar panel plant

2542.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Wind plant

2543.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Biomass plant

2550.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Potable water Systems- General
2550.Description: Establishments primarily engaged in distributing water for sale for domestic, commercial, and industrial use.

2560.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Waste water treatment Systems- General
2560.Description: Establishments primarily engaged in the collection and disposal of wastes conducted through a sewer system, including such treatment processes as may be provided and establishments primarily engaged in the collection and disposal of refuse by processing or destruction or in the operation of incinerators, waste treatment plants, landfills, or other sites for disposal of such materials.

2600.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Gas Processing Systems - General
2600.Description: Establishments engaged in the transmission and distribution and/or storage of natural gas for sale.

2610.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Gas Production Systems - General

2611.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Gas Production Systems - Gas field wells

2612.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Gas Production Systems - Gas Processing Plant

2613.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Gas Production Systems -Underground gas storage facilities

2620.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Gas Transmission Systems - General
2620.Description: Gas transportation/ transmission; contains assets such as trunk pipelines, pumping plants, and tank farms (these can be coded specifically by using existing OED construction codes)

2650.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM Communication Systems -General

2651.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Transmission Systems - Other/Unknown
2651.Description: Miscellaneous transportation/transmission; contains assets such as trunk pipelines, pumping plants, and tank farms (these can be coded specifically by using existing OED construction codes). Oil, gas and water transmission can be specified using available occupancy codes.

2750.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Bus Systems - General

2760.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Port Systems

2770.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Ferry Systems

2780.Name: Industrial Facilities Model, IFM: Airport Systems - General

3000.Name: Offshore, Unknown
3000.Description: The offshore platform occupancy is unknown.

3001.Name: Offshore, Oil production only
3001.Description: Offshore platforms that produce oil only.

3002.Name: Offshore, Gas production only
3002.Description: Offshore platforms that produce gas only.

3003.Name: Offshore, No production
3003.Description: Offshore platforms that do not produce oil or gas.

3004.Name: Offshore, Oil and gas production
3004.Description: Offshore platforms that produce oil and gas.

3006.Name: Offshore, Workover
3006.Description: Platforms that repair or stimulate existing production wells for the purpose of restoring, prolonging, or enhancing the production of hydrocarbons.

3007.Name: Offshore, Ready stacked
3007.Description: Rigs that are not under contract but generally are ready for service.

3011.Name: Buoy (single point mooring - SPM, catenary anchor leg mooring - CALM)

3014.Name: Floating liquefied natural gas (LNG), gas to liquid (GTL) vessel

3015.Name: Floating, production, storage and off-loading vessel (FPSO)

3017.Name: Offshore complex (bridge linked fixed steel structures)

3021.Name: Self elevating jack-up with independent legs

3022.Name: Self elevating jack-up with mat base

3033.Name: Offshore Wind
3033.Description: All assest associated with offshore wind. Use Construction codes to differentiate between turbines, cables and substations (both offshore and onshore substations)

3034.Name: Offshore Tidal
3034.Description: All assets associated with offshore tidal energy

3035.Name: Offshore Ocean Wave
3035.Description: All assets associated with offshore ocean wave energy

3036.Name: Floating Solar PV
3036.Description: All assets associated with floating solar PV

5000.Name: Unknown
5000.Description: The construction class is not known.

5050.Name: Wood, Wood frame
5050.Description: Wood frame (modern) structures tend to be mostly low rise (one to three stories, occasionally four). Stud walls are typically constructed of 2x4 or 2x6 inch wood members vertically set 16 or 24 inches apart. These walls are braced by plywood or by diagonals made of wood or steel. Many detached single and low-rise multiple family residences in the United States are of stud wall wood frame construction.

5051.Name: Wood, Light wood frame
5051.Description: Light wood frame structures are typically not built in the United States but would be found in other countries, such as Japan. In Hawaii, this classification would include single wall (studless) construction framed with light timber trusses.

5052.Name: Wood, Masonry veneer
5052.Description: A wood-framed structure faced with a single width of non-load-bearing concrete, stone, or clay brick attached to the stud wall.

5053.Name: Wood, Heavy timber
5053.Description: Heavy Timber structures typically have masonry walls with heavy wood column supports, and floor and roof decks are 2-3 inch tongue-and-groove planks.

5056.Name: Wood, Lightweight Cladding
5056.Description: Non-structural cladding and linings (e.g., fiber cement, plywood) used in lightweight construction that uses timber or light gauge steel framing as the structural support system.

5100.Name: Masonry, Masonry
5100.Description: Use this option when the exterior walls are constructed of masonry materials, but detailed construction information is unavailable or unknown.

5101.Name: Masonry, Adobe
5101.Description: Adobe construction uses adobe (clay) blocks with cement or cement-clay mixture as mortar. The roof consists of a timber frame with clay tiles or, in some cases, metal roofing.

5102.Name: Masonry, Rubble stone masonry
5102.Description: Rubble stone masonry consists of low-rise perimeter load bearing walls composed of irregular stones laid as coursed or uncoursed rubble in a cement mortar bed, with floor and roof joists constructed with wood framing.

5103.Name: Masonry, Unreinforced masonry bearing wall
5103.Description: Unreinforced masonry buildings consist of structures in which there is no steel reinforcing within a load bearing masonry wall. Floors, roofs, and internal partitions in these bearing wall buildings are usually of wood.

5104.Name: Masonry, Unreinforced masonry bearing frame
5104.Description: Unreinforced masonry is used for infill walls of buildings with a bearing frame. In this structure type, the masonry is intended to be used not to support gravity loads, but to assist with lateral loads.

5105.Name: Masonry, Reinforced masonry
5105.Description: Reinforced masonry construction consists of load bearing walls of reinforced brick or concrete-block masonry. Floor and roof joists constructed with wood framing are common.

5106.Name: Masonry, Reinforced masonry shear wall with mrf
5106.Description: Reinforced masonry construction consists of load bearing walls of reinforced brick or concrete-block masonry. Reinforced masonry buildings with "Moment Resisting Frames" carry lateral loads by bending. "Shear Walls" are continuous reinforced brick or reinforced hollow concrete block walls extending from the foundation to the roof and can be exterior walls or interior walls.

5107.Name: Masonry, Reinforced masonry shear wall w/o mrf
5107.Description: Reinforced masonry construction consists of load bearing walls of reinforced brick or concrete-block masonry. "Shear Walls" are continuous reinforced brick or reinforced hollow concrete block walls extending from the foundation to the roof and can be exterior walls or interior walls.

5108.Name: Masonry, Joisted masonry
5108.Description: Masonry exterior walls with roof of combustible materials on non-combustible supports.

5109.Name: Masonry, Confined Masonry
5109.Description: Confined masonry is a construction system in which plain masonry walls are confined on all four sides by reinforced concrete or reinforced masonry members. The walls themselves, however, carry all of the gravity and lateral loads.

5110.Name: Masonry, Cavity Double Brick
